attributes.action: Elmbridge Borough to become 33rd London borough following EU referendum
attributes.background: As London voted to remain in the EU, it is more evident than ever the similarities that the Borough of Elmbridge in North Surrey shares with neighbouring Greater London. As talks of further devolution of London develop, Elmbridge citizens must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
In the EU referendum, 60% voted to remain with a turnout of 78%, similar to that of London.
Elmbridge has a vibrant economy with over 5000 firms situated in the borough.
Over 45% of Elmbridge's population are educated to degree level.
Unemployment peaked at 7% in 1993 but since then has been on the decline and reached a low of 0.9% in 2000.

attributes.action: Ensure political advertising carries an ASA disclaimer
attributes.background: Unlike any other advertising, political advertising is exempt from the remit of the Advertising Standards Authority. The public expects all adverts to be legal, decent and truthful, including political adverts.  All political advertising should carry a disclaimer about exemption from ASA standards.

attributes.action: Independence referendum for N. Ireland and Scotland
attributes.background: There is a great divide between England, N. Ireland and Scotland because Scotland and N. Ireland both had majority remain but were dragged to leave the EU, we need more democracy, if they want to stay, let them, don't force them
attributes.additional_details: They all voted remain, so they should get what they want rather than being forced by another constitution that a lot of Scottish and N. Irish people want to leave. As we are the British, we pride our selves on being democratic so we must respect their decision even though we might not agree with it like when Germany, France and USA respected our decision when we voted Brexit.

attributes.action: Stop housing associations putting registered sex offenders in their properties.
attributes.background: Recently quite a number of registered sex offenders have been allowed to reside in properties owned by a housing association. Two within yards of each other. The area the properties are in is heavily populated by children, also up the road from a school.
attributes.additional_details: One of the offenders moved a few months ago, and since reoffended and been given a custodial sentence. The other is still in residence. There was another offender who owned his property, who reoffended and has since left the area. These are the registered sex offenders we are aware of, no doubt there will be more. Our concern is allowing registered sex offenders to live in an area like this, is a recipe for disaster. We have our children to think about.

attributes.action: 2 years Jnr armed forces training should count towards your pensionable service.
attributes.background:
I want the uk government to recognize armed forces training as a junior from 16 to 18 should count towards your pensionable service.
Any other industry would recognize your employment at 16 from day one.
This affects your pension as a working serviceman or woman in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I joined the Army as a 16 year old soldier & spent 2 years training.
Then completed 9 years colour service, then 1 year open engagement.
The government only recognise 9 years colour service as this technically the contract i signed. 
In business where service is recognised, where else would you have 3 years not rewarded in any way, especially as those are the years I spent learning my trade.
My pension has been devalued by 3 years because the government will only pay for my contracted period of 9.

attributes.action: Strict penalties for internet providers who fail to prevent repeat IP theft.
attributes.background:
Laws exist to protect Intellectual Property but means to enforce it can be financially unviable. Justice for all, irrelevant of budget. 

Greater penalties to service providers (SPs) failing to prevent repeat infringements & ban SPs from retaining IP unless solely to prevent repeat infringements.
attributes.additional_details:
Safe harbour is abused by SPs allowing repeat infringements and not banning all reported infringers. Sanctions to be made. Enact true Take Down - Stay Down! Technology exists to enact it but is not being utilised.

IPO & PIPCU to conduct an investigation into persistent offender Amazon, it's practices & take-down process.

Protect consumers from inferior & potentially dangerous products.

Make available funding for media campaigns to raise awareness of costs to IP owners and consumers.

attributes.action: Reduce Business rates for small businesses and Sole traders.
attributes.background: Small businesses are in serious threat of being destroyed through ever heightening rent, and furthermore unreasonable, crippling business rates set by the government.  Rates are once again rising as of next year, despite the current economic difficulties for independent businesses.
attributes.additional_details: Remember, charities that occupy commercial properties are exempt from business rates, which increases the demand from small and large businesses alike.  Rates are currently destroying family/small businesses.  Lets get this changed.

attributes.action: Implement a 12 month ban for using mobiles while driving.
attributes.background: Far too many people are still ignoring the fact that people are being injured and killed daily due to mobile phone distraction behind the wheel. If you get caught driving and using your phone you should face the same punishment as drink drivers and be banned from driving for 12 months.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 500,000 drivers still using mobile phones at wheel, study shows
At least one in 20 drivers aged under 30 have been caught flouting the law 
Report said using hand-held device is more dangerous than drink or drugs
In 2013, mobile phone use behind the wheel was factor in 22 fatal collisions


Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/

attributes.action: Keep the army bound by the European Convention on Human Rights during conflict.
attributes.background: In her conference speech, Theresa May declared that the army would have an opt-out of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) during conflict. This means, in effect, that the army would have a free hand to violate basic human rights such as freedom from torture and the right to a fair trial.
attributes.additional_details: The ECHR is an international treaty, drafted in 1950 and championed by British governments ever since. It sets out a series of fundamental rights that governments are bound to respect. This Convention was signed and ratified by the British government in the aftermath of the WWII to ensure that the human rights violations during this conflict would not happen again. For more information on the rights that the ECHR protects, visit: www.echr.coe.int/Documents/Convention_ENG.pdf

attributes.action: Fathers to have 50/50 rights and stricter penalties for breach of court order
attributes.background: I want fathers to have equal rights in a family court and not just automatically given to the mother. Also a stronger penalty for breach of court order. With the person who is breachig the court order liable to pay costs towards a new court order.
attributes.additional_details:
Time and time again fathers are being stopped from seeing their children. Even with a visitation order, the ex partner can stop them and have to be taken back to court at the expense of the father again. 

It's a lengthy and costly process and the mother has automatic residency rights over the child. The current procedures don't do enough to stop a mother from blocking contact with their children. 

If the mother blocks contact without a valid excuse, she should be made to pay future court fees

attributes.action: ban the use of prong and shock collars for dogs within the UK.
attributes.background: Prong and shock collars can cause psychological and physical harm to dogs even when correctly used and can even precipitate aggression in the animal. At present there is no legislation restricting their use and anyone can apply them to any dog.
attributes.additional_details: Many so called trainers many with few or no qualifications use them and get obedience because the dog is terrified of the pain and distress caused rather than because it has been well trained. Alternative methods are effective  see site https://positively.com/dog-training/methods-equipment/training-equipment/choke-and-prong-collars/ for details of the injuries caused by these devices

attributes.action: Make the A420 between Oxford and Swindon a dual carriageway.
attributes.background: The A420 between Oxford and Swindon is too busy  It is the main A road shortcut to the south west.  The alternative route is 19 miles longer down the A34 and the M4.  It badly needs dualling.  The proposed trunk road between Cambridge and Oxford should extended to Swindon via the A420 corridor
attributes.additional_details: The A420 between Oxford and Swindon is too busy  It is the main A road shortcut to the south west.  The alternative route is 19 miles longer down the A34 and the M4.  It badly needs dualling.  The proposed trunk road between Cambridge and Oxford should extended to Swindon via the A420 corridor

attributes.action: Change the way in which property is bought and sold in England
attributes.background: My family and I have recently been left in a bad position, because of a supposedly reliable cash buyer pulling out of purchasing our flat, a week before we were going to be moving into our newly built family home.
attributes.additional_details: I would like a legally binding contract in place at an earlier stage (for example when a price is agreed) during the property buying and selling process. This will give the seller the confidence to start spending money on their next purchase, and not be worrying about if the buyer is going to back out. If a buyer then backs out without good reason then they will be liable for all the costs that the seller has incurred, and the buyer should also lose their deposit.

attributes.action: Education should be Free. Scrap University fees. Scrap & write off student loans
attributes.background:
Education is a right. It should be more accessible to everyone regardless of their backgrounds. Without Education society can never prosper.

Student loans should also be scrapped or written off. They charge too much interest.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/may/17/george-osborne-pledge-to-scrap-very-unfair-tuition-fees-comes-to-light

attributes.action: Freeze funding for students fallen ill until recovered enough to return.
attributes.background: It is completely unfair on those students who fall ill to have to pay for their education should they want to return to study in recovery. This applies to many illnesses but especially mental illness. This petition asks for the funding to be frozen (for up to two years) until they're able to return.

attributes.action: ALL coffee, tea , cocoa, chocolate sold in UK to be Fair Trade certified.
attributes.background: Free of EU Trade Restrictions - this petition calls for legislation to end Slavery in the tea, coffee and cocoa farming industries. It calls upon the Government to pass a law requiring ALL tea and coffee and cocoa (chocolate) sold in the UK to be Fair Trade (or Rainforest Alliance) Certified.
attributes.additional_details:
Ask yourself: Is it right that tea that is sold in the UK may be picked by people in bonded labour who have to live amongst their own sewage? Is it fair that the chocolate you buy as an after-school treat for your children contains cocoa picked by a farmer who can’t afford to send her own children to school?

I have dreamt for many years that Britain would one day act to end modern Slavery. Such a law will demonstrate that the UK is outward looking and compassionate, and truly define a new era!

attributes.action:
Non Negotiable for BREXIT
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No Benefits.
attributes.background: Our local communities are getting destroyed by these mass unskilled EU immigration which is putting pressure on schools, NHS. housing, work and more important our quality of life. We want immigration which we need to progress in the world. We cant open borders for abuse by EU migrants for benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The country has voted to LEAVE the EU due to David Cameron's failure and promise to renegotiate with the EU and all the key basic requirements been watered down.

We now want the any future UK Govt to respect and honour the wishes of British people to renegotiate with the EU on the basis of referendum with (Non Negotiable for BREXIT)
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No access to any benefits.

We dont want future UK Govt to water down these main issues for other concessions from the EU.

attributes.action: Schools to have the funding for a full time teaching assistant in every class.
attributes.background: To ensure that every child is supported in their education, every primary school should have the funding to employ a full time teaching assistant in every class. This would not be to fulfil administrative tasks but to support the learning of all children.

attributes.action: Set up an inquiry into the impact of press reporting on the Brexit vote
attributes.background: A referendum such as on Brexit relies on informed decision making by the public. It is understandable that each side will represent their position in the best light possible. But we need to understand if any persons manipulated public opinion through press reporting beyond the legally acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: Just like the Chilcot inquiry into the Iraq war and the potential manipulation of public opinion through the media, we need a similar inquiry about whether any actors had vested interest in a Brexit and if so, whether they did take any steps to manipulate public opinion in an unacceptable, illegal manner by impacting press reporting on Brexit.

attributes.action: Parliament to pass a Bill affirming the UK will remain in the EU.
attributes.background:
The UK is is a Parliamentary democracy. Only Parliament has the power and the responsibility to decide this issue. Parliament is not bound by the referendum.

The majority of the UK electorate did not vote to leave.

attributes.action: We want the UK to appoint a dedicated minister for young people.
attributes.background: Young people in this country, are not being heard, and not being catered for by government. We constantly get shafted at the expense of the silver haired vote because of the perception that we aren't engaged with, or care about politics. We do care! We want somebody accountable to deal with us.
attributes.additional_details:
Ever since the 2008 recession, young people have been beaten down with a stick and told to put up.

The abolishing of EMA allowance
Trebling university fees
Taking away housing benefit for 18-21 year old's
New living wage excluding  under  25's

Are all examples of government policy designed to take away from young people in order to give to other demographics of the vote.

All in the age of low wages and astronomical rent and house prices. 
It's time we engage and let our voice be heard.

attributes.action: Regulate wasteful, non-essential overnight lighting of non-residential buildings
attributes.background: Seeking to improve & regulate employer's environmental policies requiring shops, offices and public sector buildings to turn off all unnecessary lighting overnight, allowing local councils to make exceptions for Christmas and other special occasions, and in certain tourist or cultural areas, only.
attributes.additional_details:
Follow the example of France, which introduced in 2013 the new law seeking to significantly reduce light pollution and carbon emissions by allowing local authorities to enforce fines on businesses breaking the rules, while cutting off power to repeat offenders. 

The rules should seek to target non-essential overnight lighting of shop windows and the fronts of buildings, making businesses greener & aware of their social responsibility, while significantly cutting carbon emissions per annum.

attributes.action: Change the law on eligibility to stand for elected local government posts
attributes.background: Make it unlawful to hold 2 elected posts within local government simultaneously. Make it unlawful for 2 members of the same household (eg spouses) to hold simultaneous posts within the same County council or District within that county.
attributes.additional_details: Recent elections for Police and Crime Commissioner in Warwickshire resulted in the candidate elected being the spouse of the Leader of Warwickshire County Council. The leader of Stratford upon Avon District council also holds a position on Warwickshire County Council. Other councillors hold positions on both District and County Councils. It is hard to envisage how these dual roles and close relationships can not lead to undemocratic influences, whether knowingly or unwittingly.

attributes.action: Stop British Government discriminating against people with Disabilities
attributes.background: Cody has been on ancestral visa, he has now applied for indefinite leave to remain. Part of this application is a life in the UK test and an English test. Cody has documentary proof that he suffers from severe Dyslexia and Specific Language Impairment. The Government has denied him an excemption.
attributes.additional_details: Under their own rules he should have been granted an exception. Cody has now been refused indefinite leave to remain due to not sitting the test. This is a blatant discriminatory act against people with Disabilities. Under the UK Disabilities Act of 2010. Please support this petition otherwise this means deportation where he has no family or friends with no means of support.

attributes.action: Parliamentary Candidates must have lived in the seat for 2 years before standing
attributes.background: I find it undemocratic that Parliamentary Candidates can stand with no history or knowledge whatsoever of the seat, whereas you must be on the Electoral roll or live in the ward for local elections.
attributes.additional_details:
Here in North Dorset we had a very able local hopeful for the Tories, however the candidate selected was from the PM;s home town of Witney, having stood in the previous election in Cardiff.
This is the Westminster bubble in action.

attributes.action: A database for compulsive gamblers to register to, banning further gambling
attributes.background: Gambling addictions are often underestimated in their control over individuals and the devastating impacts on the victim, family and friends. Effects of gambling unfortunately can include lost life savings, pensions, subsequent divorces and homelessness among many others.
attributes.additional_details: Gambling sites, advertisements, constant emails and the availability of gambling make it increasingly difficult for a compulsive gambler to resist the compulsion to gamble. Many people want to give up, the problem is the temptation, current protection offered by sites is not good enough. I propose a national data base where addicts can register to say they wish to be banned from all sites and casinos, it is then the responsibility of the sites or casinos to check this database to protect users

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory dog licences. Making it offence to own a dog without one.
attributes.background:
Unfortunately back in 1987 when policing  issues were harder this law was Abolished. 
With modern laws and regulations a new licence can be enforced. 
This will aid in the reduction of Back Yard Breeding and the ever increasing over population of stray dogs in rescue centres accross the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Most countries still have licences. 
Having one makes the owner accountable for its dogs actions. 
If your dog goes missing the chances of getting it back are greater. 
No puppy can be bought without a licence including their vaccination details. 
Greater fines for owners without a licence.
DNA records would be held for prosecution and identification purposes. 
Breeders can only sell dogs with a recognised licence and permit.
Service dogs would be free. 
Elderly concession rates.

attributes.action: Preserve all existing rights of UK citizens to Freedom of Movement in the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum text did not instruct the Government to sign away UK citizens' current rights to travel, reside, work, study, or retire freely anywhere in the EU, without discrimination. Though on Brexit we lose EU citizenship, the Govt. has a duty to preserve our rights in its Brexit Agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
These Factsheets summarise your current rights of Free Movement 1) as EU citizens, & 2) via UK membership of the Single Market. You will lose these rights unless they are protected. 

1) Free Movement of Persons: (skip the Schengen section) http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_2.1.3.html 
2) Free Movement of Workers: (different emphasis: this is oriented to the Single Market): http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_3.1.3.html

attributes.action: Make basic paediatric first aid/cpr part of antenatal care
attributes.background: Many babies/young children could be saved if new parents were given guidance on simple cpr and first aid in relation to babies and young children. Early Years Professionals and healthcare professionals receive training, however, parents (who are with their children the majority of the time) do not.

attributes.action: Standardise child age groups where there is an entrance fee. 18+ is adult
attributes.background: I believe pricing of  attractions should be fair. And having to pay adult prices to gain entry to attractions, shows, holidays. Flight's etc for anyone under 18 is wrong. When you have a young family it is becoming increasingly expensive to do anything when you have to pay full price adult children
attributes.additional_details: Alton Towers Adult prices start at 12+ since when have 12 year old been adults. This is one example of countless organisations and companies that routinely choose thier own age limits for pricing. We need a country if not worldwide pricing structure so parents don't get ripped off

attributes.action: To make the use of the word "midget" a hate crime.
attributes.background: The use of the word "midget" is used as a hate crime directed at people of short stature. People with restricted growth, frequently experience others insulting them either directly or indirectly with the inappropriate word "midget". This must stop! It is cruel and vile and has no place in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Restricted growth is commonly described as having a final adult height of 4’10” or less due to a medical condition.
Most people who have restricted growth have it due to a genetic condition. There are estimated to be several hundred conditions that can cause restricted growth, these can cause proportionate or disproportionate, such as Achondroplasia, restricted growth.

attributes.action: Remove the EU flag from UK driving licenses and V5 documents as soon as possible
attributes.background: The UK is now in the process of leaving the EU. It is therefore unnecessary and wrong to have important UK legal documents displaying the EU flag. Along with having a blue UK passport; UK driving licenses and V5 documents should display the Union Jack instead of the EU flag.

attributes.action: Allow cystic fibrosis patients decide when they are ready for a lung transplant
attributes.background: My brother in law needs a lung transplant as he suffers from cystic fibrosis, he has been in hospital for most of this year when he gets out he is back in within 12 days he is only 22 his lung function is around 30% and his consultant says he cant have a lung transplant yet should be his choice
attributes.additional_details: Every human being should have a good quality of life,  why should 1000s of people die every year not just with cystic fibrosis but everyone who needs an organ transplant? Most people die as a result of being placed on the transplant list to late, My brother in law who needs a lung transplant does not take life for granted he does not drink, smoke or take drugs he shows courage and determination all the time people like him are an inspiration for us all let it be his choice

attributes.action: School Summer holiday to be reduced and Easter holiday increased
attributes.background: Reduce 6-7 week holiday and increase Easter break, to allow more family's to take a holiday to hot continents, or visit relatives
attributes.additional_details: If summer holiday is reduced and Easter increased then an option to take a descent holiday is increased twice a year to travel to hot continents and less  absences during school time

attributes.action: Condemn the Xenophobia of UK Tabloids and Ensure EU Free Movement Continues.
attributes.background: We call on MPs to condemn incitement by our tabloid press against foreigners and enact laws making it an offence. We call for a relationship with Europe that allows free movement from the EU so talented business people, scientists, academics, skilled workers & engineers feel welcome & not hated.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/jul/11/police-blame-worst-rise-in-recorded-hate-on-eu-referendum. 
http://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=50675#.V4YqavkrLmE
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/brexit-britain-latest-news-academics-threaten-to-quit-brain-drain-over-racist-xenophobic-eu-a7133316.html
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/brexitvote/2016/06/29/letter-to-mps-from-a-remain-voter-a-plea-for-realism-tolerance-and-honesty/
http://nyti.ms/29H7OnH

attributes.action: Make welfare forms easier to understand for people with learning disabilities
attributes.background: As a young adult with a learning disability and autism. i have found that most forms that are used by local councils and the DWP are in a format that many people with a learning disability will struggle to understand and process them leading applicants to get anxious and reluctant to apply.
attributes.additional_details: When corresponding the information. the letters and forms don't always specify what you need to send off, and the way the questions are phrased or relayed a person with a disabilitiy wont understand what is in front of them or will struggle look at all information, so the councils and dwp need to make all official documents learning disability friendly

attributes.action: Women and Equalitiy Committee to conduct a full review of the TransInquiry
attributes.background: The Women and Equalities Commision published the Transgender Equality Report on the 7th July 2016. It does not address any of the main concerned of Transgended Men and Women in the UK. It pastes over cracks in the systems, law and the rights of Trans people. Our community demands a full review.
attributes.additional_details: There are 35 recommendations writhin the report and the majority are incomplete. The Transgender community requires that a further review is taken to ensure that the Women and Equalities Commision continue the work that have done to fully address all 35 recommendations and too ensure all are fully addressed in the shortest possible timeframe. This report must be treated as an interim report that is a work in progress. We demand the right to appropriate treatment and complete self determination.

attributes.action: British Isles devolution to allow regions to choose RemaIN in the EU or Leave.
attributes.background: Mainland Denmark is in the EU, whilst devolved Greenland and Faroe Islands are in Denmark but not in the EU. Great Britain and Northern Ireland are in the UK and therefore the EU, while the Isles of Jersey, Guernsey and Man are in the British Isles but not in the UK or the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Areas of England and Wales that wish to leave the EU, could devolve out of the UK (and therefore the EU), whilst remaining in the Kingdom of the British Isles. We would all still be British citizens under the Queen and sovereign parliament in Westminster. 
London, NI and Scotland could remain in the EU.
This would be cheaper, simpler, more flexible and quicker than Brexit.
We request that the UK government hold a referendum on all realistic options for the relationship between the UK and the EU.

attributes.action: Make It A Legal Requirement To Scan All Cats For A Microchip
attributes.background: My Portia went missing 9 weeks ago and no one has handed her in. Someone must have taken her, thinking she was a stray. Maybe they don't know she's missing, but this is why I want this law in place. I am heartbroken and so are other owners who are missing their cats.
attributes.additional_details: Many cats are taken in, believed to be strays and are never taken to the vets to see if the animal has an owner first.

attributes.action: Ban lorries from overtaking on dual carriageways, and motorways between 7am-7pm
attributes.background:
We've all been stuck on a dual carriageway doing fifty behind a lorry driver who feel they need to overtake another lorry doing two or three miles per hour less than them.

The same happens on motorways and causes the same issues when a somebody tries to overtake both of those lorries at sixty.
attributes.additional_details:
It clogs up road which are designed to be freely moving and can cause miles of tailbacks.

Even more frustrating is when as soon as they have finished their overtake they take the exit off the road.

My proposal is to ban lorries from overtaking on a dual carriageway at any time, and a ban on lorries overtaking between 7am and 7pm on motorways.

If you agree please sign.

attributes.action: Remove the Barnett Formula from being applied in the UK
attributes.background: The Barnett Formula does not conform with modern equality as it allow some groups to benefit and others not. We should all be subject to the same rules
attributes.additional_details: No evidence is needed as all facts are published by the UK government

attributes.action: We do not want a Norwegian EEC paid membership trade deal, or a Swiss deal.
attributes.background:
In the recent EU in/out referendum, the majority of the UK voted to leave the european union and we do not want a Norwegian or Swiss deal which would defeat the leave vote and why we voted leave.
We do not want to be a paid member of the EEC single market trading zone.
attributes.additional_details:
Some Conservative ministers have been reported by the BBC, Boris Johnson in particular of desiring a Norwegian trade zone membership deal against the interests of Britain and the majority of British voters who voted to leave europe and the single market.

Staying in the single market will do the economic damage David Cameron was talking about, and it will prevent us taking back control of our borders, immigration, fishing limits and full law making powers therefore it is against public interest.

attributes.action: Stop the UK Government leaving the EU without consent from Scottish Parliament.
attributes.background:
Brexit politicians misled millions of voters on immigration, funding, the NHS, and the economic impact of leaving the EU.

We the undersigned call on David Cameron and Nicola Sturgeon to ensure the views of the Scottish people are represented and cease the process of leading the UK out of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland has to agree to the UK leaving the EU in order for Brexit to go ahead. A second referendum is extremely unlikely. The best chance we have of stopping the UK proceeding with leaving the EU is for the Scottish Parliament to refuse to give formal legislative consent.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on London becoming independent from the UK
attributes.background:
London is the world's capital. 300+ languages are spoken here. Immigrants are welcome, and are vital to our economy.

We voted decisively to stay in the EU. Our global outlook sets us apart from the rest of England.

London's population is 8.5m – Scotland's is 5.3m.

Independence makes sense.
attributes.additional_details: Specifics: If you live within the M25, you get a vote – just like in the Scottish referendum. It doesn't matter if you're a British citizen or not. If you don't live within the M25, you don't get a vote.

attributes.action: Call a general election in the next 90 days as a result of the EU vote.
attributes.background: This vote should never have been called and as a result the population of the United Kingdom has no confidence in the leadership of the government. We demand a general election in the next 90 days to elect new leaders to help manage this emerging crisis.

attributes.action: Stop permission to build Branston Road School Academy on current proposed site
attributes.background: Vital arable land will be lost. Hedgerow vital to wildlife will be destroyed. Applicant, Planning Authority & Education Authority are one and the same! Surrounding villages were promised green barrier and then this was permitted! Villages not designed to cope with current traffic without school.
attributes.additional_details: Tatenhill Parish Councillors can be contacted for further info.  Burton Mail also has articles referencing objections.

attributes.action: Deploy warships in the English Channel to stop and deter illegal migrants.
attributes.background: Over the past few weeks there have been known several incidents of illegal migrants trying to cross the English Channel to get in the UK. So far only one of the attempted crossings have been successful but it is inevitable that more will get into the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
For too long, the UK has been lenient when it comes to illegals trying to get into our nation and we must set an example to defend ourselves from possible terrorists posing as migrants (as seen during the Cologne and Paris attacks). And also to prevent further actual refugees from risking their lives trying to get into the UK.

I ask the Government to deploy warships into the English Channel to; stop and turn around illegals, deter further illegals from risking their lives in the effort to get into the UK, and if necessary use lethal force to defend British waters.

attributes.action: Change the law so that cowboy trades people are prosecuted in a criminal court
attributes.background: People save hard to have construction work done at there property, only to hire a trades person who stops work half way through a job leaving the home owner with an unfinished property and thousands of pounds out of pocket. This should be considered a criminal offence as county court is no deterrent
attributes.additional_details: Rogue trades people are often taken to county court by home owners when a trades person does not complete the work he/she has been contracted to complete. If the home owner wins the case the trades person will have a county court judgement which the home owner will then have to enforce if the trades person does not pay. This still does not guarantee that the home owner will receive any money. County court judgements are no deterrent to a trades person that has no assets that can be seized.

attributes.action: Life sentence for spreading ISIS propaganda
attributes.background: Life sentence for spreading ISIS propaganda, publicly supporting ISIS or  getting people to join ISIS.

attributes.action: Different exams for private and state educated pupils
attributes.background: Privately educated children should sit different GCSE and A Level exams to children from state schools. This is because the quality of education for children who's parents are paying over £15k a year will undoubtedly be very different to a student attending the local state school.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing this to happen, the government is not doing enough to close the gap between the rich and the poor. Every year, 5 top independent schools send over 2000 pupils to Oxbridge between them. These kids have almost definitely performed well on the same exams as your sons and daughters whilst driving up the grade boundaries and making it harder to achieve top grades to apply to top universities. How can a child who did not pay for their education be expected to compete with children who did?
